title: Definitions
context: [Part XXXVII.] domestic violence fatality review ยง321-471 Definitions. As used in this part: &ldquo;Dating relationship&rdquo; as used in this section has the same meaning prescribed in section 586-1. &ldquo;Department&rdquo; means the department of health. &ldquo;Director&rdquo; means the director of health or the director&rsquo;s designated representative. &ldquo;Domestic violence&rdquo; means physical harm, bodily injury, assault, or the threat of imminent physical harm, bodily injury, or assault, extreme psychological abuse or malicious property damage between family or household members. &ldquo;Domestic violence fatality review information&rdquo; means information regarding a victim, including but not limited to: (1) Social, medical, and legal history; (2) Death and birth certificates; (3) Law enforcement investigative information and data; (4) Medical examiner or coroner investigative information and data; (5) Parole and probation information and records; (6) Information and records of social services agencies; (7) Educational records; and (8) Health care institution information. &ldquo;Domestic violence fatality review team&rdquo; means those individuals appointed by the director to review domestic violence fatalities. &ldquo;Extreme psychological abuse&rdquo; as used in this section has the same meaning prescribed in section 586-1. &ldquo;Family or household members&rdquo; as used in this section means: (1) Each legal parent; (2) The natural mother; (3) The natural father; (4) Each natural or adopted child; (5) Each sibling or person related by consanguinity; (6) Spouses or former spouses; (7) Reciprocal beneficiaries or former reciprocal beneficiaries; (8) Each person who has or has had a dating relationship; (9) Each person jointly residing or formerly residing in the same dwelling unit; and (10) Any other person who, or legal entity that, is a victim&rsquo;s legal or physical custodian or guardian, or who is otherwise responsible for the victim&rsquo;s care, other than an authorized agency that assumes such a legal status or relationship with the victim under chapter 587A. &ldquo;Malicious property damage&rdquo; as used in this section has the same meaning prescribed in section 586-1. &ldquo;Preventable death&rdquo; means a death that reasonable medical, social, legal, psychological, or educational intervention may have prevented. &ldquo;Provider of medical care&rdquo; means any health care practitioner who provides, or a facility through which is provided, any medical evaluation or treatment, including dental and mental health evaluation or treatment. &ldquo;Suspect&rdquo; means a person suspected of having caused a victim&rsquo;s death. &ldquo;Victim&rdquo; means an adult whose death is suspected of having been caused by domestic violence or domestic violence-related suicide. [L 2006, c 82, pt of ยง1; am L 2010, c 135, ยง7]
